qas.question: Where is the Chapultepec Zoo located?

answers.text: Chapultepec Park in the Miguel Hidalgo

qas.question: When was the Chapultepec Zoo opened?
What sets the Zoo San Juan de Aragon apart from the others?

answers.text: species that are in danger of extinction

qas.question: How big is the Zoo Los Coyotes?
How many animals inhabit Zoo Los Coyotes?

context: Mexico City has three zoos. Chapultepec Zoo, the San Juan de Aragon Zoo and Los Coyotes Zoo. Chapultepec Zoo is located in the first section of <a0_0>Chapultepec Park in the Miguel Hidalgo<a0_0/>. It was opened in <a1_0>1924<a1_0/>. Visitors can see about 243 specimens of different species including kangaroos, giant panda, gorillas, caracal, hyena, hippos, jaguar, giraffe, lemur, lion, among others. Zoo San Juan de Aragon is near the San Juan de Aragon Park in the Gustavo A. Madero. In this zoo, opened in 1964, there are <a2_0>species that are in danger of extinction<a2_0/> such as the jaguar and the Mexican wolf. Other guests are the golden eagle, pronghorn, bighorn sheep, caracara, zebras, African elephant, macaw, hippo, among others. Zoo Los Coyotes is a <a3_0>27.68-acre (11.2 ha)<a3_0/> zoo located south of Mexico City in the Coyoacan. It was inaugurated on February 2, 1999. It has <a4_0>more than 301 specimens<a4_0/> of 51 species of wild native or endemic fauna from the Mexico City. You can admire eagles, ajolotes, coyotes, macaws, bobcats, Mexican wolves, raccoons, mountain lions, teporingos, foxes, white-tailed deer.
